Some users believe the processing of email message content by Google's [[Gmail]] service goes beyond proper use. The point is often made that people without Gmail accounts, who have not agreed to the Gmail terms of service, but send email to Gmail users have their correspondence analyzed without permission. Google claims that mail sent to or from Gmail is never read by a human being beyond the account holder, and is only used to improve relevance of advertisements. Other popular email services such as [[Hotmail]] also scan incoming email to try to determine whether it is unsolicited spam email (which Gmail also does). Gmail claims to automatically delete all messages placed in the trash bin after 30 days. This is, however, false, as Gmail users who check their trash bins see that their messages are not deleted unless the user manaully deletes them.
